name: Vegan Mexican Hot Chocolate Ice Cream
description: This Mexican hot chocolate ice cream is sweet and creamy with a hint of cinnamon. It is also no-churn and dairy free!!

video.name: Vegan Mexican Hot Chocolate Ice Cream
video.description: Dairy free mexican hot chocolate ice cream, made with almond-coconut milk, avocado and maple syrup.

recipeIngredient: 1  Avocado ripe, (cut in half, flesh removed)

recipeInstructions.text: Bring the coconut-almond milk to a very low simmer over low heat. Add chocolate tablets, and stir with a whisk or molinillo.
recipeInstructions.name: Bring the coconut-almond milk to a very low simmer over low heat. Add chocolate tablets, and stir with a whisk or molinillo.

recipeInstructions.text: Once the chocolate has dissolved pour it in a container and let it cool completely in the fridge or freezer.
recipeInstructions.name: Once the chocolate has dissolved pour it in a container and let it cool completely in the fridge or freezer.

recipeInstructions.text: Place the chocolate mixture, avocado, and maple syrup in the blender, and puree until smooth.
recipeInstructions.name: Place the chocolate mixture, avocado, and maple syrup in the blender, and puree until smooth.

recipeInstructions.text: Pour into ice trays and freeze overnight.
recipeInstructions.name: Pour into ice trays and freeze overnight.

recipeInstructions.text: The following day unmold the cubes and place in the food processor. Process until smooth (hold on to your food processor because it’s going to shake!)
